greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest prime of the form abs(n^k - k^n), the absolute difference between n^k and k^n, or -1 if no such prime exists.
comment: If p is a prime then a(p+1) = p, with k = 1.

a(15) = 15^68 - 68^15, a 79-digit (certified) prime. a(16), if it exists, is greater than 16^39000 - 39000^16. a(17)..a(21) = 130783, 17, 523927, 19, 21^32 - 32^21 a(22), if it exists, is greater than 22^4000 - 4000^22. - _Ryan Propper_, Jun 20 2005
a(16) does not exist because 16^k - k^16 = (2^k + k^4)*(2^k - k^4)*(4^k + k^8) is composite for all k>0 except k = 16 when 16^k - k^16 = 0. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Oct 04 2006

a(16) = -1. a(64) = -1. a(p+1) = p for prime p (note that corresponding k = 1). Corresponding minimum numbers k such that a(n) = Abs[n^k - k^n] are listed in A123701[n] = {3, 5, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 2, 3, 8, 1, 6, 1, 68, -1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 32, 0, 60, 1, 12, 5, 0, 0, 98, 1, 42, 1, 0, 69, 6, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 60, 1, 32, 1, 44, 0, 110, 1, 24, 9, 2, 3, 2, 1, 0, 0, 0, 93, 0, 1, 180, 1, 88, -1, ...}, where k = -1 corresponds to a(n) = -1 and k = 0 corresponds to unknown a(n).
mathematica: Do[k = 1; While[ !PrimeQ[Abs[n^k - k^n]], k++ ]; Print[Abs[n^k - k^n]], {n, 1, 14}] (* _Ryan Propper_, Jun 20 2005 *)
xref: Cf. A123701 = Minimum number k such that A078202(n) = abs(n^k - k^n) is prime.
Cf. A122735 = Smallest prime of the form (n^k - k^n) for k > 1.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 21 2002
ext: Corrected and extended by _Ryan Propper_, Jun 20 2005
